title: What is the difference between hydrogen bond and hydrogen bonding? - Quora

response.answer_text: What is the difference between getting drunk and a drink? You need a drink to get drunk, but a couple drinks won't make you drunk. Hydrogen bonding is forming a hydrogen bond between 2 molecules or more molecules. A hydrogen bond is an electrostatic interaction between 2 or more molecules with OH groups covalently bonded. The H of one of the alcohol molecules is attracted to the OH of water, and these interactions keep the alcohol dissolved in water. H bonds are the reason Luke's dissolve likes.
